32string thread_names[] = {"__thread_id_x", "__thread_id_y", "__thread_id_z", "__thread_id_w"};
33string block_names[] = {"__block_id_x", "__block_id_y", "__block_id_z", "__block_id_w"};
34
35class ExtractBlockSize : public IRVisitor {
36 Expr block_extent[4], block_count[4];
37 string block_var_name[4];
38
39 using IRVisitor::visit;
40
41 void found_thread_for(int dim, const string &name, const Expr &extent) {
42 internal_assert(dim >= 0 && dim < 4);
43 if (!block_extent[dim].defined()) {
44 block_extent[dim] = extent;
45 } else {
46 block_extent[dim] = simplify(Max::make(extent, block_extent[dim]));
47 }
48 }
49
50 void found_block_for(int dim, const string &name, Expr extent) {
51 internal_assert(dim >= 0 && dim < 4);
52 internal_assert(!block_count[dim].defined());
53 block_count[dim] = std::move(extent);
54 block_var_name[dim] = name;
55 }
56
57 void visit(const For *op) override {
58 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
59 if (ends_with(op->name, thread_names[i])) {
60 found_thread_for(i, op->name, op->extent);
61 } else if (ends_with(op->name, block_names[i])) {
62 found_block_for(i, op->name, op->extent);
63 }
64 }
65
66 IRVisitor::visit(op);
67
68 Scope<Interval> scope;
69 scope.push(op->name, Interval(op->min, simplify(op->min + op->extent - 1)));
70 // For non-rectangular thread loops, use a bounding box. We'll inject if statements later.
71 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
72 if (block_extent[i].defined() &&
73 expr_uses_var(block_extent[i], op->name)) {
74 block_extent[i] = simplify(common_subexpression_elimination(block_extent[i]));
75 block_extent[i] = simplify(bounds_of_expr_in_scope(block_extent[i], scope).max);
76 }
77 }
78 }
79
80 void visit(const LetStmt *op) override {
81 IRVisitor::visit(op);
82 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
83 if (block_extent[i].defined() &&
84 expr_uses_var(block_extent[i], op->name)) {
85 block_extent[i] = simplify(Let::make(op->name, op->value, block_extent[i]));
86 }
87 }
88 }
89
90public:
91 int blocks_dimensions() const {
92 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
93 if (!block_count[i].defined()) {
94 return i;
95 }
96 }
97 return 4;
98 }
99
100 int threads_dimensions() const {
101 for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
102 if (!block_extent[i].defined()) {
103 return i;
104 }
105 }
106 return 4;
107 }
108
109 Expr num_threads(int d) const {
110 return block_extent[d];
111 }
112
113 Expr num_blocks(int d) const {
114 return block_count[d];
115 }
116
117 Expr block_var(int d) const {
118 return Variable::make(Int(32), block_var_name[d]);
119 }
120
121 Expr thread_var(int d) const {
122 // Thread variables get canonical names
123 return Variable::make(Int(32), "." + thread_names[d]);
124 }
125};

127class NormalizeDimensionality : public IRMutator {
128 using IRMutator::visit;
129
130 const ExtractBlockSize &block_size;
131 const DeviceAPI device_api;
132
133 int depth;
134 int max_depth;
135
136 Stmt wrap(Stmt s) {
137 if (depth != 0) {
138 return mutate(s);
139 }
140 max_depth = 0;
141 s = mutate(s);
142 if (is_no_op(s)) {
143 return s;
144 }
145 while (max_depth < block_size.threads_dimensions()) {
146 string name = thread_names[max_depth];
147 s = For::make("." + name, 0, 1, ForType::GPUThread, device_api, s);
148 max_depth++;
149 }
150 return s;
151 }
152
153 Stmt visit(const Block *op) override {
154 Stmt first = wrap(op->first);
155
156 Stmt rest;
157 if (op->rest.defined()) {
158 rest = wrap(op->rest);
159 }
160
161 if (first.same_as(op->first) &&
162 rest.same_as(op->rest)) {
163 return op;
164 } else {
165 return Block::make(first, rest);
166 }
167 }
168
169 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
170 if (CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_thread_var(op->name)) {
171 depth++;
172 if (depth > max_depth) {
173 max_depth = depth;
174 }
175 Stmt stmt = IRMutator::visit(op);
176 depth--;
177 return stmt;
178 } else {
179 return IRMutator::visit(op);
180 }
181 }
182
183public:
184 NormalizeDimensionality(const ExtractBlockSize &e, DeviceAPI device_api)
185 : block_size(e), device_api(device_api), depth(0), max_depth(0) {
186 }
187};

189class ReplaceForWithIf : public IRMutator {
190 using IRMutator::visit;
191
192 const ExtractBlockSize &block_size;
193
194 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
195 if (CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_thread_var(op->name)) {
196 int dim;
197 for (dim = 0; dim < 4; dim++) {
198 if (ends_with(op->name, thread_names[dim])) {
199 break;
200 }
201 }
202
203 internal_assert(dim >= 0 && dim < block_size.threads_dimensions());
204
205 Stmt body = mutate(op->body);
206
207 Expr var = Variable::make(Int(32), "." + thread_names[dim]);
208 body = substitute(op->name, var + op->min, body);
209
210 if (equal(op->extent, block_size.num_threads(dim))) {
211 return body;
212 } else {
213 Expr cond = var < op->extent;
214 return IfThenElse::make(cond, body, Stmt());
215 }
216 } else {
217 return IRMutator::visit(op);
218 }
219 }
220
221public:
222 ReplaceForWithIf(const ExtractBlockSize &e)
223 : block_size(e) {
224 }
225};

227class ExtractSharedAndHeapAllocations : public IRMutator {
228 using IRMutator::visit;

230 struct IntInterval {
231 IntInterval()
232 : IntInterval(0, 0) {
233 }
234 IntInterval(int min, int max)
235 : min(min), max(max) {
236 }
237 int min;
238 int max;
239 };
240
241 struct SharedAllocation {
242 string name;
243 Type type;
244 Expr size;
245 IntInterval liveness; // Start and end of the barrier stage at which this allocation is used.
246 MemoryType memory_type; // Should be GPUShared or Heap
247 bool striped_over_threads;
248 bool size_computed_on_host;
249 };
250
251 struct AllocGroup {
252 AllocGroup() = default;
253 AllocGroup(const SharedAllocation &alloc)
254 : name(alloc.name),
255 widest_type(alloc.type),
256 max_size(alloc.size),
257 memory_type(alloc.memory_type) {
258 group.push_back(alloc);
259 }
260
261 void insert(const SharedAllocation &alloc) {
262 internal_assert(alloc.memory_type == memory_type);
263 if (alloc.type.bytes() == widest_type.bytes()) {
264 max_size = max(max_size, alloc.size);
265 } else if (alloc.type.bytes() > widest_type.bytes()) {
266 // Change units of max_size
267 int size_ratio = alloc.type.bytes() / widest_type.bytes();
268 max_size = max(max_size / size_ratio, alloc.size);
269 widest_type = alloc.type;
270 } else {
271 int size_ratio = widest_type.bytes() / alloc.type.bytes();
272 max_size = max(max_size, alloc.size / size_ratio);
273 }
274 group.push_back(alloc);
275 name += "_" + alloc.name;
276 }
277
278 // Only need to check the back of the vector since we always insert
279 // the most recent allocation at the back.
280 bool is_free(int stage) const {
281 return group.back().liveness.max < stage;
282 }
283
284 string name;
285 Type widest_type;
286 Expr max_size; // In units of the widest type
287 vector<SharedAllocation> group; // Groups of allocs that should be coalesced together
288 MemoryType memory_type; // All allocations in the group have this memory type
289 };
290
291public:
292 vector<SharedAllocation> allocations;
293
294private:
295 map<string, SharedAllocation *> shared;
296
297 bool in_threads;
298
299 int barrier_stage;
300
301 const DeviceAPI device_api;
302
303 string thread_id_var_name, num_threads_var_name;
304
305 bool may_merge_allocs_of_different_type;
306
307 // A loop on the host used to compute the shared memory size
308 Stmt host_side_preamble;
309
310 void precompute_allocation_size(SharedAllocation &s) {
311 Expr val = Load::make(Int(32), s.name + ".shared_size", 0,
312 Buffer<>{}, Parameter{}, const_true(), ModulusRemainder{});
313 Stmt update_size = Store::make(s.name + ".shared_size", max(s.size, val), 0,
314 Parameter{}, const_true(), ModulusRemainder{});
315
316 if (host_side_preamble.defined()) {
317 host_side_preamble = Block::make(host_side_preamble, update_size);
318 } else {
319 host_side_preamble = update_size;
320 }
321 s.size_computed_on_host = true;
322 s.size = Variable::make(Int(32), s.name + ".shared_size_var");
323 }
324
325 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
326 bool is_thread_loop = CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_thread_var(op->name);
327 ScopedValue<bool> old_in_threads(in_threads, in_threads || is_thread_loop);
328
329 // Set aside the allocations we've found so far.
330 vector<SharedAllocation> old;
331 old.swap(allocations);
332
333 // And any preamble
334 Stmt old_preamble = host_side_preamble;
335 host_side_preamble = Stmt();
336
337 // Find allocations inside the loop body
338 Stmt body = mutate(op->body);
339
340 // Expand any new shared allocations found in the body using the loop bounds.
341 Scope<Interval> scope;
342 scope.push(op->name, Interval(op->min, simplify(op->min + op->extent - 1)));
343 for (SharedAllocation &s : allocations) {
344 // If the size depends on the loop variable, take the max
345 // over all loop iterations
346 if (expr_uses_var(s.size, op->name) && !s.size_computed_on_host) {
347 s.size = simplify(common_subexpression_elimination(s.size));
348 // It's worth working extra hard to remove any
349 // repeated dependence on the block var
350 s.size = solve_expression(s.size, op->name).result;
351 s.size = simplify(common_subexpression_elimination(s.size));
352 switch (is_monotonic(s.size, op->name)) {
353 case Monotonic::Unknown:
354 // TODO: if bounds_of_expr_in_scope becomes more
355 // powerful than is_monotonic, it might be better
356 // to call it here. That would be risky though, as
357 // it's not exact.
358 debug(1)
359 << "Shared allocation for " << s.name
360 << " has a size that is non-monontonic in the gpu block variable " << op->name
361 << ": " << s.size << "\n";
362 if (get_compiler_logger()) {
363 get_compiler_logger()->record_non_monotonic_loop_var(op->name, s.size);
364 }
365 precompute_allocation_size(s);
366 break;
367 case Monotonic::Increasing:
368 s.size = substitute(op->name, simplify(op->min + op->extent - 1), s.size);
369 break;
370 case Monotonic::Constant:
371 // The size expression used the variable, but we
372 // may have successfully eliminated it above, or
373 // is_monotonic might have detected that the
374 // dependence is false somehow. Just treat it as
375 // decreasing...
376 case Monotonic::Decreasing:
377 s.size = substitute(op->name, op->min, s.size);
378 break;
379 }
380 }
381 if (in_threads && op->is_parallel()) {
382 // For parallel inner loops, make a separate slice per loop iteration
383 s.size *= op->extent;
384 }
385 }
386
387 // Add back on the allocations we set aside.
388 if (!allocations.empty()) {
389 allocations.insert(allocations.end(), old.begin(), old.end());
390 } else {
391 allocations.swap(old);
392 }
393
394 Expr new_min = mutate(op->min);
395 Expr new_extent = mutate(op->extent);
396
397 if (host_side_preamble.defined()) {
398 string loop_name = unique_name('t');
399 Expr v = Variable::make(Int(32), loop_name);
400 host_side_preamble = substitute(op->name, v, host_side_preamble);
401 host_side_preamble = For::make(loop_name, new_min, new_extent,
402 ForType::Serial, DeviceAPI::None, host_side_preamble);
403 if (old_preamble.defined()) {
404 host_side_preamble = Block::make(old_preamble, host_side_preamble);
405 }
406 } else {
407 host_side_preamble = old_preamble;
408 }
409
410 return For::make(op->name, new_min, new_extent,
411 op->for_type, op->device_api, body);
412 }
413
414 Stmt visit(const Block *op) override {
415 if (!in_threads && op->rest.defined()) {
416 Stmt first = mutate(op->first);
417 barrier_stage++;
418 Stmt rest = mutate(op->rest);
419
420 if (first.same_as(op->first) &&
421 rest.same_as(op->rest)) {
422 return op;
423 } else {
424 return Block::make(first, rest);
425 }
426 } else {
427 return IRMutator::visit(op);
428 }
429 }
430
431 Stmt visit(const IfThenElse *op) override {
432 Expr condition = mutate(op->condition);
433 Stmt before_preamble = host_side_preamble;
434 host_side_preamble = Stmt();
435 Stmt then_case = mutate(op->then_case);
436 Stmt then_preamble = host_side_preamble;
437 host_side_preamble = Stmt();
438 Stmt else_case = mutate(op->else_case);
439 Stmt else_preamble = host_side_preamble;
440
441 if (then_preamble.defined()) {
442 host_side_preamble = IfThenElse::make(condition, then_preamble, else_preamble);
443 } else if (else_preamble.defined()) {
444 host_side_preamble = IfThenElse::make(!condition, else_preamble);
445 }
446 if (before_preamble.defined() && host_side_preamble.defined()) {
447 host_side_preamble = Block::make(before_preamble, host_side_preamble);
448 } else if (before_preamble.defined()) {
449 host_side_preamble = before_preamble;
450 }
451 return IfThenElse::make(condition, then_case, else_case);
452 }
453
454 int alloc_node_counter = 0;
455
456 Stmt visit(const Allocate *op) override {
457 user_assert(!op->new_expr.defined())
458 << "Allocate node inside GPU kernel has custom new expression.\n"
459 << "(Memoization is not supported inside GPU kernels at present.)\n";
460
461 bool fixed_size_thread_allocation = (op->constant_allocation_size() != 0) && in_threads;
462
463 if ((fixed_size_thread_allocation &&
464 op->memory_type != MemoryType::Heap &&
465 op->memory_type != MemoryType::GPUShared &&
466 op->memory_type != MemoryType::GPUTexture) ||
467 op->memory_type == MemoryType::Register ||
468 op->memory_type == MemoryType::Stack) {
469 // These allocations go in register or local memory
470 return IRMutator::visit(op);
471 }
472
473 user_assert(op->memory_type == MemoryType::Auto ||
474 op->memory_type == MemoryType::GPUShared ||
475 op->memory_type == MemoryType::GPUTexture ||
476 op->memory_type == MemoryType::Heap)
477 << "Allocation " << op->name << " must live in shared or heap memory, "
478 << "but is scheduled to live in " << op->memory_type << " memory.\n";
479
480 SharedAllocation alloc;
481 alloc.name = op->name + "." + std::to_string(alloc_node_counter++);
482 alloc.type = op->type;
483 alloc.liveness = IntInterval(barrier_stage, barrier_stage);
484 alloc.size = 1;
485 for (size_t i = 0; i < op->extents.size(); i++) {
486 alloc.size *= op->extents[i];
487 }
488 alloc.size = simplify(alloc.size);
489 alloc.memory_type = op->memory_type;
490 alloc.size_computed_on_host = false;
491 alloc.striped_over_threads = in_threads;
492
493 if (alloc.memory_type == MemoryType::Auto) {
494 if (in_threads) {
495 // Dynamic allocation within the threads loop go on
496 // the heap by default.
497 alloc.memory_type = MemoryType::Heap;
498 } else {
499 // Allocations at the blocks level go in shared by
500 // default.
501 alloc.memory_type = MemoryType::GPUShared;
502 }
503 }
504
505 // Updates the liveness by checking for all uses
506 shared.emplace(op->name, &alloc);
507 Stmt stmt = IRMutator::visit(op);
508 op = stmt.as<Allocate>();
509 internal_assert(op);
510
511 allocations.push_back(alloc);
512 shared.erase(op->name);
513 return op->body;
514 }
515
516 Expr mutate_index(SharedAllocation *alloc, const Expr &index) {
517 Expr idx = mutate(index);
518 if (alloc->striped_over_threads) {
519 idx *= Variable::make(Int(32), num_threads_var_name);
520 idx += Variable::make(Int(32), thread_id_var_name);
521 }
522 return idx;
523 }
524
525 Expr visit(const Load *op) override {
526 auto it = shared.find(op->name);
527 if (it != shared.end()) {
528 SharedAllocation *alloc = it->second;
529 alloc->liveness.max = barrier_stage;
530 Expr predicate = mutate(op->predicate);
531 Expr index = mutate_index(alloc, op->index);
532 return Load::make(op->type, alloc->name,
533 index, op->image, op->param, predicate, op->alignment);
534 } else {
535 return IRMutator::visit(op);
536 }
537 }
538
539 Stmt visit(const Store *op) override {
540 auto it = shared.find(op->name);
541 if (it != shared.end()) {
542 SharedAllocation *alloc = it->second;
543 alloc->liveness.max = barrier_stage;
544 Expr predicate = mutate(op->predicate);
545 Expr index = mutate_index(alloc, op->index);
546 Expr value = mutate(op->value);
547 return Store::make(alloc->name, value, index,
548 op->param, predicate, op->alignment);
549 } else {
550 return IRMutator::visit(op);
551 }
552 }
553
554 Stmt visit(const LetStmt *op) override {
555 Expr value = mutate(op->value);
556
557 // Set aside the allocations we've found so far.
558 Stmt old_preamble = host_side_preamble;
559 host_side_preamble = Stmt();
560 vector<SharedAllocation> old;
561 old.swap(allocations);
562
563 Stmt body = mutate(op->body);
564
565 // Wrap let expression for any allocations found within
566 for (SharedAllocation &s : allocations) {
567 if (expr_uses_var(s.size, op->name) && !s.size_computed_on_host) {
568 s.size = Let::make(op->name, op->value, s.size);
569 s.size = simplify(s.size);
570 }
571 }
572
573 if (host_side_preamble.defined() &&
574 stmt_uses_var(host_side_preamble, op->name)) {
575 host_side_preamble = LetStmt::make(op->name, op->value, host_side_preamble);
576 }
577
578 if (old_preamble.defined()) {
579 if (host_side_preamble.defined()) {
580 host_side_preamble = Block::make(old_preamble, host_side_preamble);
581 } else {
582 host_side_preamble = old_preamble;
583 }
584 }
585
586 // Add back on the allocations we set aside.
587 if (!allocations.empty()) {
588 allocations.insert(allocations.end(), old.begin(), old.end());
589 } else {
590 allocations.swap(old);
591 }
592
593 if (op->body.same_as(body) && value.same_as(op->value)) {
594 return op;
595 } else {
596 return LetStmt::make(op->name, value, body);
597 }
598 }

600 // Return index to free_spaces where 'alloc' should be coalesced. Return -1
601 // if there isn't any.
602 int find_best_fit(const vector<AllocGroup> &mem_allocs,
603 const vector<int> &free_spaces,
604 const SharedAllocation &alloc, int stage) {
605 int free_idx = -1;
606
607 Expr alloc_size = simplify(alloc.size);
608
609 // We prefer to coalesce dynamic-sized allocation with a dynamic-sized one and
610 // constant-sized alloc with a constant-sized one. If we can't find any free
611 // space with a matching type, we pick the most-recently freed space of the
612 // other type (e.g. pick constant-sized free space for a dynamic-sized allocation
613 // and vice versa). We prefer the most-recently freed space as stages that are
614 // close together usually have relatively similar allocation size. For
615 // constant-sized allocation, we prioritize free space which size differs
616 // the least with 'alloc' (can be smaller or larger; it does not really
617 // matter since we take the max of the two as the new size).
618
619 if (!is_const(alloc_size)) { // dynamic-sized alloc
620 for (int i = free_spaces.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
621 internal_assert(free_spaces[i] >= 0 && free_spaces[i] < (int)mem_allocs.size());
622 internal_assert(mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].is_free(stage));
623
624 if (mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].memory_type != alloc.memory_type) {
625 continue;
626 }
627
628 if (!may_merge_allocs_of_different_type &&
629 mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].group[0].type != alloc.type) {
630 // Types must also match for OpenGLCompute
631 continue;
632 }
633
634 if (!is_const(mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].max_size)) {
635 return i;
636 } else if (free_idx == -1) {
637 free_idx = i;
638 }
639 }
640 } else { // constant-sized alloc
641 int64_t diff = -1;
642 for (int i = free_spaces.size() - 1; i >= 0; --i) {
643 internal_assert(free_spaces[i] >= 0 && free_spaces[i] < (int)mem_allocs.size());
644 internal_assert(mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].is_free(stage));
645
646 if (mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].memory_type != alloc.memory_type) {
647 continue;
648 }
649
650 if (!may_merge_allocs_of_different_type &&
651 mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].group[0].type != alloc.type) {
652 // Types must also match for OpenGLCompute
653 continue;
654 }
655
656 if (is_const(mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]].max_size)) {
657 const auto &candidate_group = mem_allocs[free_spaces[i]];
658 Expr size = alloc_size * alloc.type.bytes();
659 Expr dist = candidate_group.max_size * candidate_group.widest_type.bytes() - size;
660 const int64_t *current_diff = as_const_int(simplify(dist));
661 internal_assert(current_diff != nullptr);
662 int64_t abs_diff = std::abs(*current_diff);
663 if ((free_idx == -1) || (abs_diff < diff)) {
664 diff = abs_diff;
665 free_idx = i;
666 }
667 } else if (free_idx == -1) {
668 free_idx = i;
669 }
670 }
671 }
672
673 return free_idx;
674 }
675
676 // Given some allocations, return a vector of allocation group where each group
677 // consists of a number of allocations which should be coalesced together
678 // in the shared memory.
679 vector<AllocGroup> allocate_funcs(vector<SharedAllocation> &allocations) {
680 // Sort based on the ascending order of the min liveness stage,
681 // then sort based on the ascending order of the max liveness stage.
682 sort(allocations.begin(), allocations.end(),
683 [](const SharedAllocation &lhs, const SharedAllocation &rhs) {
684 if (lhs.liveness.min < rhs.liveness.min) {
685 return true;
686 } else if (lhs.liveness.min == rhs.liveness.min) {
687 return lhs.liveness.max < rhs.liveness.max;
688 }
689 return false;
690 });
691
692 vector<AllocGroup> mem_allocs;
693 vector<int> free_spaces; // Contains index to free spaces in mem_allocs
694 int start_idx = 0;
695
696 for (int stage = 0; stage <= barrier_stage; ++stage) {
697 for (int i = start_idx; i < (int)allocations.size(); ++i) {
698 if (allocations[i].liveness.min > stage) {
699 break;
700 } else if (allocations[i].liveness.min == stage) { // Allocate
701 int free_idx = find_best_fit(mem_allocs, free_spaces, allocations[i], stage);
702 if (free_idx != -1) {
703 mem_allocs[free_spaces[free_idx]].insert(allocations[i]);
704 free_spaces.erase(free_spaces.begin() + free_idx);
705 } else {
706 mem_allocs.emplace_back(allocations[i]);
707 }
708 } else if (allocations[i].liveness.max == stage - 1) { // Free
709 int free_idx = -1;
710 for (int j = 0; j < (int)mem_allocs.size(); ++j) { // Find the index of the space to free
711 if (mem_allocs[j].group.back().name == allocations[i].name) {
712 free_idx = j;
713 break;
714 }
715 }
716 internal_assert(free_idx >= 0 && free_idx < (int)mem_allocs.size());
717 free_spaces.push_back(free_idx);
718 start_idx = i + 1;
719 }
720 }
721 }
722
723 return mem_allocs;
724 }
725
726 Expr get_block_id(const ExtractBlockSize &bs) const {
727 Expr block_id = 0;
728 for (int d = bs.blocks_dimensions() - 1; d >= 0; d--) {
729 block_id *= bs.num_blocks(d);
730 block_id += bs.block_var(d);
731 }
732 return block_id;
733 }
734
735 Expr max_over_blocks(const Expr &e, const ExtractBlockSize &bs) const {
736 Scope<Interval> scope;
737 for (int d = 0; d < bs.blocks_dimensions(); d++) {
738 scope.push(bs.block_var(d).as<Variable>()->name,
739 Interval(0, bs.num_blocks(d) - 1));
740 }
741 Interval in = bounds_of_expr_in_scope(simplify(e), scope);
742 if (in.has_upper_bound()) {
743 return in.max;
744 } else {
745 return Expr();
746 }
747 }
748
749 struct GlobalAllocation {
750 string name;
751 Expr size;
752 Type type;
753 };
754 vector<GlobalAllocation> global_allocations;
755
756public:
757 Stmt rewrap_block(Stmt s, const ExtractBlockSize &bs) {
758
759 // Combine the allocations into groups that have disjoint
760 // lifetimes, and then cluster the groups according to which
761 // ones can share a single allocation. For cuda, opencl, and
762 // similar we get one big combined allocation per memory
763 // type. For openglcompute and direct3d, we also separate by
764 // element type.
765 map<pair<MemoryType, Type>, vector<AllocGroup>> clustered_allocs;
766
767 {
768 vector<AllocGroup> mem_allocs = allocate_funcs(allocations);
769
770 // Every allocation must belong to one group
771 internal_assert(allocations.size() >= mem_allocs.size());
772
773 // Sort the allocations by the max size in bytes of the primitive
774 // types in the group. Because the type sizes are then decreasing powers of
775 // two, doing this guarantees that all allocations are aligned
776 // to then element type as long as the original one is aligned
777 // to the widest type.
778 sort(mem_allocs.begin(), mem_allocs.end(),
779 [](const AllocGroup &lhs, const AllocGroup &rhs) {
780 return lhs.widest_type.bytes() > rhs.widest_type.bytes();
781 });
782
783 for (const auto &alloc : mem_allocs) {
784 Type t = may_merge_allocs_of_different_type ? UInt(8) : alloc.widest_type;
785 pair<MemoryType, Type> key{alloc.memory_type, t};
786 clustered_allocs[key].push_back(alloc);
787 }
788 }
789
790 for (auto &p : clustered_allocs) {
791 vector<AllocGroup> &cluster = p.second;
792 // Heap or shared?
793 MemoryType memory_type = p.first.first;
794 // Type of the combined Allocate node
795 Type alloc_type = p.first.second;
796
797 // Figure out a name for the cluster, the total size of
798 // the cluster (in terms of the alloc_type), and the
799 // widest type in the cluster (which may be wider than the
800 // alloc_type).
801 string name;
802 Expr total_size = 0;
803 Type widest_type;
804 for (const auto &alloc : cluster) {
805 if (name.empty()) {
806 name = alloc.name;
807 widest_type = alloc.widest_type;
808 } else {
809 name += "__" + alloc.name;
810 if (alloc.widest_type.bytes() > widest_type.bytes()) {
811 widest_type = alloc.widest_type;
812 }
813 }
814 int ratio = alloc.widest_type.bytes() / alloc_type.bytes();
815 internal_assert(ratio != 0)
816 << "alloc_type should have been at most as wide as the widest type in group\n";
817 total_size += alloc.max_size * ratio;
818 }
819
820 // Upgrade the alloc type to the widest type found, and
821 // downgrade total_size accordingly.
822 int ratio = widest_type.bytes() / alloc_type.bytes();
823 internal_assert(ratio != 0)
824 << "alloc_type should have been at most as wide as the widest type in cluster\n";
825 if (ratio != 1) {
826 total_size += ratio - 1;
827 total_size /= ratio;
828 }
829 alloc_type = widest_type;
830
831 // Remove any dependence on the block vars by taking a max
832 {
833 Expr size = max_over_blocks(total_size, bs);
834 internal_assert(size.defined())
835 << memory_type
836 << " memory used by GPU kernel varies with the block index in an unbounded way: "
837 << total_size << "\n";
838 total_size = size;
839 }
840
841 const string total_size_name = name + ".size";
842 Expr total_size_var = Variable::make(Int(32), total_size_name);
843
844 // Make the allocation
845 if (memory_type == MemoryType::Heap) {
846 global_allocations.push_back(GlobalAllocation{name, total_size, alloc_type});
847 } else {
848 s = Allocate::make(name, alloc_type, memory_type,
849 {total_size_var}, const_true(), s);
850 }
851
852 // Define a group offset for each group in the
853 // cluster. The group offsets are in elements of
854 // widest_type across the entire cluster. Using that,
855 // define an individual offset for each allocation in the
856 // group, using units of that allocation's type.
857 for (int i = (int)(cluster.size()) - 1; i >= 0; i--) {
858 Expr group_offset = Variable::make(Int(32), name + "." + std::to_string(i) + ".offset");
859
860 for (const SharedAllocation &alloc : cluster[i].group) {
861 // Change units, as described above.
862 Expr offset = group_offset;
863 internal_assert(alloc.type.bytes() <= widest_type.bytes());
864 if (alloc.type.bytes() < widest_type.bytes()) {
865 offset *= (widest_type.bytes() / alloc.type.bytes());
866 }
867 offset = simplify(offset);
868
869 // Rewrite all loads and stores to point to the allocation
870 // cluster they belong to with the appropriate offset into it.
871 class RewriteGroupAccess : public IRMutator {
872 using IRMutator::visit;
873 Expr visit(const Load *op) override {
874 if (op->name == alloc_name) {
875 return Load::make(op->type, cluster_name, mutate(op->index) + offset,
876 op->image, op->param, mutate(op->predicate),
877 op->alignment);
878 } else {
879 return IRMutator::visit(op);
880 }
881 }
882
883 Stmt visit(const Store *op) override {
884 if (op->name == alloc_name) {
885 return Store::make(cluster_name, mutate(op->value), mutate(op->index) + offset,
886 op->param, mutate(op->predicate), op->alignment);
887 } else {
888 return IRMutator::visit(op);
889 }
890 }
891 const string &alloc_name;
892 const string &cluster_name;
893 const Expr &offset;
894
895 public:
896 RewriteGroupAccess(const string &alloc_name,
897 const string &cluster_name,
898 const Expr &offset)
899 : alloc_name(alloc_name), cluster_name(cluster_name), offset(offset) {
900 }
901 } rewriter{alloc.name, name, offset};
902 s = rewriter.mutate(s);
903 }
904
905 // Define the group offset in terms of the previous group in the cluster
906 Expr offset;
907 if (i > 0) {
908 // Build off the last offset
909 offset = Variable::make(Int(32), name + "." + std::to_string(i - 1) + ".offset");
910 int ratio = (widest_type.bytes() / cluster[i - 1].widest_type.bytes());
911 internal_assert(ratio != 0);
912 offset += simplify((cluster[i - 1].max_size + ratio - 1) / ratio);
913 } else {
914 if (memory_type == MemoryType::Heap) {
915 // One slice of a larger global allocation
916 offset = get_block_id(bs) * total_size_var;
917 } else {
918 // Base address for shared memory is zero
919 offset = 0;
920 }
921 }
922
923 s = LetStmt::make(group_offset.as<Variable>()->name, simplify(offset), s);
924 }
925 s = LetStmt::make(total_size_name, total_size, s);
926 }
927
928 // Resolve thread_id and threads_per_block variables, uses of
929 // which were injected above if any allocation was striped
930 // over the threads.
931 Expr thread_id = 0, num_threads = 1;
932 for (int d = bs.threads_dimensions() - 1; d >= 0; d--) {
933 num_threads *= bs.num_threads(d);
934 thread_id *= bs.num_threads(d);
935 thread_id += bs.thread_var(d);
936 }
937 if (stmt_uses_var(s, thread_id_var_name)) {
938 s = LetStmt::make(thread_id_var_name, thread_id, s);
939 }
940 if (stmt_uses_var(s, num_threads_var_name)) {
941 s = LetStmt::make(num_threads_var_name, num_threads, s);
942 }
943
944 return s;
945 }
946
947 Stmt rewrap_kernel_launch(Stmt s, const ExtractBlockSize &bs, DeviceAPI device_api) {
948
949 for (const auto &alloc : global_allocations) {
950 Expr total_size = alloc.size;
951
952 Expr device_interface = make_device_interface_call(device_api);
953 string buffer_name = alloc.name + ".buffer";
954 Expr buffer_var = Variable::make(type_of<halide_buffer_t *>(), buffer_name);
955
956 BufferBuilder builder;
957 builder.mins.emplace_back(0);
958 builder.extents.push_back(total_size);
959 builder.strides.emplace_back(1);
960 builder.type = alloc.type;
961 builder.dimensions = 1 + bs.blocks_dimensions();
962
963 for (int d = 0; d < bs.blocks_dimensions(); d++) {
964 Expr next_stride =
965 builder.strides.back() *
966 builder.extents.back();
967 builder.strides.push_back(next_stride);
968 builder.extents.emplace_back(bs.num_blocks(d));
969 }
970 Expr buffer = builder.build();
971 Expr allocate_heap_call = Call::make(Int(32), "halide_device_malloc",
972 {buffer_var, device_interface}, Call::Extern);
973 string allocate_heap_result_var_name = unique_name('t');
974 Expr allocate_heap_result_var = Variable::make(Int(32), allocate_heap_result_var_name);
975 Stmt check_allocated =
976 AssertStmt::make(allocate_heap_result_var == 0, allocate_heap_result_var);
977 Expr device_field = Call::make(Handle(), Call::buffer_get_device, {buffer_var}, Call::Extern);
978 s = LetStmt::make(alloc.name, device_field, s);
979 s = Block::make(check_allocated, s);
980 s = LetStmt::make(allocate_heap_result_var_name, allocate_heap_call, s);
981 s = Allocate::make(buffer_name, alloc.type,
982 MemoryType::Auto, {}, const_true(), s,
983 buffer, "halide_device_free_as_destructor");
984 }
985
986 s = compute_shared_memory_sizes_on_host(s);
987
988 return s;
989 }
990
991 Stmt compute_shared_memory_sizes_on_host(Stmt result) {
992 if (!host_side_preamble.defined()) {
993 return result;
994 }
995
996 // Make all the let stmts that define the size vars
997 for (auto &alloc : allocations) {
998 if (alloc.size_computed_on_host) {
999 string alloc_name = alloc.name + ".shared_size";
1000 string var_name = alloc.name + ".shared_size_var";
1001 Expr val = Load::make(Int(32), alloc_name, 0,
1002 Buffer<>{}, Parameter{}, const_true(), ModulusRemainder{});
1003 result = LetStmt::make(var_name, val, result);
1004 alloc.size = Variable::make(Int(32), var_name);
1005 }
1006 }
1007
1008 // Prefix the preamble
1009 result = Block::make(host_side_preamble, result);
1010
1011 // Wrap the preamble in all the allocation nodes
1012 for (auto &alloc : allocations) {
1013 if (alloc.size_computed_on_host) {
1014 string alloc_name = alloc.name + ".shared_size";
1015 Stmt init = Store::make(alloc_name, 0, 0,
1016 Parameter{}, const_true(), ModulusRemainder{});
1017 result = Block::make(init, result);
1018 result = Allocate::make(alloc_name, Int(32), MemoryType::Stack, {1}, const_true(), result);
1019 }
1020 }
1021
1022 return result;
1023 }
1024
1025 ExtractSharedAndHeapAllocations(DeviceAPI d)
1026 : in_threads(false),
1027 barrier_stage(0),
1028 device_api(d),
1029 thread_id_var_name(unique_name('t')),
1030 num_threads_var_name(unique_name('t')),
1031 may_merge_allocs_of_different_type(device_api != DeviceAPI::OpenGLCompute &&
1032 device_api != DeviceAPI::D3D12Compute) {
1033 }
1034}; // namespace Internal
1035
1036// Pull out any allocate node outside of the innermost thread
1037// block. Should only be run after shared allocations have already
1038// been extracted.
1039class ExtractRegisterAllocations : public IRMutator {
1040 using IRMutator::visit;
1041
1042 struct RegisterAllocation {
1043 string name;
1044 string loop_var; // The nearest enclosing loop over threads. Empty if it's at block level.
1045 Type type;
1046 Expr size;
1047 MemoryType memory_type; // Should be Auto, Stack, or Register
1048 };
1049
1050 bool in_lane_loop = false;
1051
1052 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
1053 ScopedValue<string> old_loop_var(loop_var);
1054
1055 if (op->for_type == ForType::GPULane) {
1056 loop_var = op->name;
1057 internal_assert(!in_lane_loop);
1058 ScopedValue<bool> old_in_lane_loop(in_lane_loop, true);
1059 has_lane_loop = true;
1060 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1061 } else {
1062 if (op->for_type == ForType::GPUThread) {
1063 has_thread_loop = true;
1064 loop_var = op->name;
1065 }
1066
1067 // Hoisting an allocation out of a vectorized for loop
1068 // would break here. We should already have hoisted
1069 // vectorized allocations.
1070 internal_assert(op->for_type != ForType::Vectorized);
1071
1072 // Set aside the allocations we've found so far.
1073 vector<RegisterAllocation> old;
1074 old.swap(allocations);
1075
1076 // Find allocations inside the loop body
1077 Stmt body = mutate(op->body);
1078
1079 // Expand any new register allocations found in the body using the loop bounds.
1080 Scope<Interval> scope;
1081 scope.push(op->name, Interval(op->min, simplify(op->min + op->extent - 1)));
1082
1083 // Expand the inner allocations using the loop bounds.
1084 for (RegisterAllocation &s : allocations) {
1085 if (expr_uses_var(s.size, op->name)) {
1086 s.size = bounds_of_expr_in_scope(s.size, scope).max;
1087 }
1088 }
1089
1090 // Add back on the allocations we set aside.
1091 if (!allocations.empty()) {
1092 allocations.insert(allocations.end(), old.begin(), old.end());
1093 } else {
1094 allocations.swap(old);
1095 }
1096
1097 return For::make(op->name, mutate(op->min), mutate(op->extent), op->for_type, op->device_api, body);
1098 }
1099 }
1100
1101 int alloc_node_counter = 0;
1102 Scope<string> alloc_renaming;
1103
1104 Stmt visit(const Allocate *op) override {
1105 if (in_lane_loop) {
1106 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1107 }
1108
1109 user_assert(op->memory_type == MemoryType::Stack ||
1110 op->memory_type == MemoryType::Register ||
1111 op->memory_type == MemoryType::Heap ||
1112 op->memory_type == MemoryType::Auto)
1113 << "Allocation " << op->name << " is scheduled inside a loop over GPU threads, so "
1114 << "it must live in stack memory, heap memory, or registers. "
1115 << "Shared allocations at this loop level are not yet supported.\n";
1116
1117 ScopedBinding<int> p(register_allocations, op->name, 0);
1118
1119 RegisterAllocation alloc;
1120 alloc.name = op->name + "." + std::to_string(alloc_node_counter++);
1121 alloc.type = op->type;
1122 alloc.size = 1;
1123 alloc.loop_var = loop_var;
1124 for (size_t i = 0; i < op->extents.size(); i++) {
1125 alloc.size *= op->extents[i];
1126 }
1127 alloc.size = simplify(mutate(alloc.size));
1128 alloc.memory_type = op->memory_type;
1129
1130 allocations.push_back(alloc);
1131 {
1132 ScopedBinding<string> bind(alloc_renaming, op->name, alloc.name);
1133 return mutate(op->body);
1134 }
1135 }
1136
1137 Expr visit(const Load *op) override {
1138 string new_name = op->name;
1139 if (alloc_renaming.contains(op->name)) {
1140 new_name = alloc_renaming.get(op->name);
1141 }
1142 return Load::make(op->type, new_name, mutate(op->index),
1143 op->image, op->param, mutate(op->predicate),
1144 op->alignment);
1145 }
1146
1147 Stmt visit(const Store *op) override {
1148 string new_name = op->name;
1149 if (alloc_renaming.contains(op->name)) {
1150 new_name = alloc_renaming.get(op->name);
1151 }
1152 return Store::make(new_name, mutate(op->value), mutate(op->index),
1153 op->param, mutate(op->predicate), op->alignment);
1154 }
1155
1156 template<typename ExprOrStmt, typename LetOrLetStmt>
1157 ExprOrStmt visit_let(const LetOrLetStmt *op) {
1158 ExprOrStmt body = op->body;
1159
1160 body = mutate(op->body);
1161 Expr value = mutate(op->value);
1162
1163 for (RegisterAllocation &s : allocations) {
1164 if (expr_uses_var(s.size, op->name)) {
1165 s.size = simplify(Let::make(op->name, value, s.size));
1166 }
1167 }
1168
1169 if (op->body.same_as(body) && op->value.same_as(value)) {
1170 return op;
1171 } else {
1172 return LetOrLetStmt::make(op->name, value, body);
1173 }
1174 }
1175
1176 Expr visit(const Let *op) override {
1177 return visit_let<Expr>(op);
1178 }
1179
1180 Stmt visit(const LetStmt *op) override {
1181 return visit_let<Stmt>(op);
1182 }
1183
1184 Scope<int> register_allocations;
1185 string loop_var;
1186
1187public:
1188 vector<RegisterAllocation> allocations;
1189
1190 Stmt rewrap(Stmt body, const string &loop_var) {
1191 for (RegisterAllocation &alloc : allocations) {
1192 if ((!loop_var.empty() && ends_with(alloc.loop_var, loop_var)) |
1193 (loop_var.empty() && alloc.loop_var.empty())) {
1194 body = Allocate::make(alloc.name, alloc.type, alloc.memory_type, {alloc.size}, const_true(), body);
1195 }
1196 }
1197 return body;
1198 }
1199
1200 bool has_lane_loop = false;
1201 bool has_thread_loop = false;
1202};
1203
1204class InjectThreadBarriers : public IRMutator {
1205 bool in_threads, injected_barrier;
1206
1207 using IRMutator::visit;
1208
1209 const ExtractSharedAndHeapAllocations &block_allocs;
1210 const ExtractRegisterAllocations &register_allocs;
1211
1212 std::set<std::string> shared_stores;
1213 std::set<std::string> device_stores;
1214 std::set<std::string> shared_loads;
1215 std::set<std::string> device_loads;
1216
1217 MemoryType memory_type_for_name(const std::string &name) {
1218 for (const auto &x : register_allocs.allocations) {
1219 if (x.name == name) {
1220 return x.memory_type;
1221 }
1222 }
1223 for (const auto &x : block_allocs.allocations) {
1224 if (x.name == name) {
1225 return x.memory_type;
1226 }
1227 }
1228 // Not allocated here, so must assume it's input/output
1229 // of shader
1230 return MemoryType::Auto;
1231 }
1232
1233 Stmt make_barrier(int mask) {
1234 return Evaluate::make(Call::make(Int(32), Call::gpu_thread_barrier,
1235 {IntImm::make(Int(32), mask)},
1236 Call::Intrinsic));
1237 }
1238
1239 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
1240 ScopedValue<bool> old_in_threads(in_threads,
1241 (in_threads ||
1242 op->for_type == ForType::GPUThread ||
1243 op->for_type == ForType::GPULane));
1244
1245 ScopedValue<bool> old_injected_barrier(injected_barrier, false);
1246
1247 if (!is_parallel(op->for_type)) {
1248 Stmt body = mutate(op->body);
1249 // Serial for loops at the block level with internal
1250 // synchronization also need synchronization after each
1251 // loop iteration.
1252 if (!in_threads && injected_barrier) {
1253 // Any memory access fences should be handled by the
1254 // synchronizations within the block
1255 body = Block::make(body, make_barrier(0));
1256 }
1257 return For::make(op->name, op->min, op->extent,
1258 op->for_type, op->device_api, body);
1259 } else {
1260 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1261 }
1262 }
1263
1264 Stmt visit(const Store *op) override {
1265 debug(4) << "Encountered store to " << op->name << "\n";
1266 auto mem_type = memory_type_for_name(op->name);
1267 switch (mem_type) {
1268 case MemoryType::GPUShared:
1269 debug(4) << " memory type is shared\n";
1270 shared_stores.insert(op->name);
1271 break;
1272 case MemoryType::Auto:
1273 case MemoryType::Heap:
1274 case MemoryType::GPUTexture:
1275 debug(4) << " memory type is heap or auto\n";
1276 device_stores.insert(op->name);
1277 break;
1278 case MemoryType::Stack:
1279 case MemoryType::Register:
1280 case MemoryType::LockedCache:
1281 case MemoryType::VTCM:
1282 break;
1283 }
1284
1285 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1286 }
1287
1288 Expr visit(const Load *op) override {
1289 debug(4) << "Encountered load from " << op->name << "\n";
1290 auto mem_type = memory_type_for_name(op->name);
1291 switch (mem_type) {
1292 case MemoryType::GPUShared:
1293 debug(4) << " memory type is shared\n";
1294 shared_loads.insert(op->name);
1295 break;
1296 case MemoryType::Auto:
1297 case MemoryType::Heap:
1298 case MemoryType::GPUTexture:
1299 debug(4) << " memory type is heap or auto\n";
1300 device_loads.insert(op->name);
1301 break;
1302 case MemoryType::Stack:
1303 case MemoryType::Register:
1304 case MemoryType::LockedCache:
1305 case MemoryType::VTCM:
1306 break;
1307 }
1308
1309 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1310 }
1311
1312 Stmt visit(const Block *op) override {
1313 if (!in_threads && op->rest.defined()) {
1314 // First, we record which loads from shared/device memory occur
1315 // in the rest block
1316 Stmt rest = mutate(op->rest);
1317
1318 // Now, record which stores occur in the first stmt
1319 // of this block
1320 shared_stores.clear();
1321 device_stores.clear();
1322 Stmt first = mutate(op->first);
1323
1324 // If there are any loads in the rest part that
1325 // load from something stored in first, insert the appropriate
1326 // fence type
1327 int mask = 0;
1328 for (const auto &st : shared_stores) {
1329 auto elem = shared_loads.find(st);
1330 if (elem != shared_loads.end()) {
1331 mask |= CodeGen_GPU_Dev::MemoryFenceType::Shared;
1332 break;
1333 }
1334 }
1335 for (const auto &st : device_stores) {
1336 auto elem = device_loads.find(st);
1337 if (elem != device_loads.end()) {
1338 mask |= CodeGen_GPU_Dev::MemoryFenceType::Device;
1339 break;
1340 }
1341 }
1342 injected_barrier = true;
1343 return Block::make({first, make_barrier(mask), rest});
1344 } else {
1345 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1346 }
1347 }
1348
1349public:
1350 InjectThreadBarriers(ExtractSharedAndHeapAllocations &sha, ExtractRegisterAllocations &ra)
1351 : in_threads(false),
1352 block_allocs(sha),
1353 register_allocs(ra) {
1354 }
1355};
1356
1357class FuseGPUThreadLoopsSingleKernel : public IRMutator {
1358 using IRMutator::visit;
1359 const ExtractBlockSize &block_size;
1360 ExtractSharedAndHeapAllocations &block_allocations;
1361
1362 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
1363 if (ends_with(op->name, ".__block_id_x")) {
1364 Stmt body = op->body;
1365
1366 // This is the innermost loop over blocks.
1367 debug(3) << "Fusing thread block:\n"
1368 << body << "\n\n";
1369
1370 NormalizeDimensionality n(block_size, op->device_api);
1371 body = n.mutate(body);
1372
1373 debug(3) << "Normalized dimensionality:\n"
1374 << body << "\n\n";
1375
1376 Expr block_size_x = block_size.threads_dimensions() ? block_size.num_threads(0) : 1;
1377 ExtractRegisterAllocations register_allocs;
1378 ForType innermost_loop_type = ForType::GPUThread;
1379 if (block_size.threads_dimensions()) {
1380 body = register_allocs.mutate(body);
1381 if (register_allocs.has_lane_loop) {
1382 innermost_loop_type = ForType::GPULane;
1383 }
1384 }
1385
1386 debug(3) << "Extracted register-level allocations:\n"
1387 << body << "\n\n";
1388
1389 if (register_allocs.has_thread_loop) {
1390 // If there's no loop over threads, everything is already synchronous.
1391 InjectThreadBarriers i{block_allocations, register_allocs};
1392 body = i.mutate(body);
1393 }
1394
1395 debug(3) << "Injected synchronization:\n"
1396 << body << "\n\n";
1397
1398 ReplaceForWithIf f(block_size);
1399 body = f.mutate(body);
1400
1401 debug(3) << "Replaced for with if:\n"
1402 << body << "\n\n";
1403
1404 // There is always a loop over thread_id_x
1405 string thread_id = "." + thread_names[0];
1406 // Add back in any register-level allocations
1407 body = register_allocs.rewrap(body, thread_id);
1408 body = For::make(thread_id, 0, block_size_x, innermost_loop_type, op->device_api, body);
1409
1410 // Rewrap the whole thing in other loops over threads
1411 for (int i = 1; i < block_size.threads_dimensions(); i++) {
1412 thread_id = "." + thread_names[i];
1413 body = register_allocs.rewrap(body, thread_id);
1414 body = For::make("." + thread_names[i], 0, block_size.num_threads(i),
1415 ForType::GPUThread, op->device_api, body);
1416 }
1417 thread_id.clear();
1418 body = register_allocs.rewrap(body, thread_id);
1419
1420 debug(3) << "Rewrapped in for loops:\n"
1421 << body << "\n\n";
1422
1423 // Add back in the shared allocations
1424 body = block_allocations.rewrap_block(body, block_size);
1425 debug(3) << "Add back in shared allocations:\n"
1426 << body << "\n\n";
1427
1428 if (body.same_as(op->body)) {
1429 return op;
1430 } else {
1431 return For::make(op->name, op->min, op->extent, op->for_type, op->device_api, body);
1432 }
1433 } else {
1434 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1435 }
1436 }
1437
1438public:
1439 FuseGPUThreadLoopsSingleKernel(const ExtractBlockSize &bs,
1440 ExtractSharedAndHeapAllocations &sm)
1441 : block_size(bs), block_allocations(sm) {
1442 }
1443};
1444
1445class FuseGPUThreadLoops : public IRMutator {
1446 using IRMutator::visit;
1447
1448 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
1449 user_assert(!(CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_thread_var(op->name)))
1450 << "Loops over GPU thread variable: \"" << op->name
1451 << "\" is outside of any loop over a GPU block variable. "
1452 << "This schedule is malformed. There must be a GPU block "
1453 << "variable, and it must reordered to be outside all GPU "
1454 << "thread variables.\n";
1455
1456 if (CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_block_var(op->name)) {
1457 // Do the analysis of thread block size and shared memory
1458 // usage.
1459 ExtractBlockSize block_size;
1460 Stmt loop = Stmt(op);
1461 loop.accept(&block_size);
1462
1463 ExtractSharedAndHeapAllocations block_allocations(op->device_api);
1464 loop = block_allocations.mutate(loop);
1465
1466 debug(3) << "Pulled out shared allocations:\n"
1467 << loop << "\n\n";
1468
1469 // Mutate the inside of the kernel
1470 loop = FuseGPUThreadLoopsSingleKernel(block_size, block_allocations).mutate(loop);
1471
1472 loop = block_allocations.rewrap_kernel_launch(loop, block_size, op->device_api);
1473
1474 return loop;
1475 } else {
1476 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1477 }
1478 }
1479};
1480
1481class ZeroGPULoopMins : public IRMutator {
1482 bool in_non_glsl_gpu = false;
1483 using IRMutator::visit;
1484
1485 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
1486 ScopedValue<bool> old_in_non_glsl_gpu(in_non_glsl_gpu);
1487
1488 in_non_glsl_gpu = (in_non_glsl_gpu && op->device_api == DeviceAPI::None) ||
1489 (op->device_api == DeviceAPI::CUDA) || (op->device_api == DeviceAPI::OpenCL) ||
1490 (op->device_api == DeviceAPI::Metal) ||
1491 (op->device_api == DeviceAPI::D3D12Compute);
1492
1493 Stmt stmt = IRMutator::visit(op);
1494 if (CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_var(op->name) && !is_const_zero(op->min)) {
1495 op = stmt.as<For>();
1496 internal_assert(op);
1497 Expr adjusted = Variable::make(Int(32), op->name) + op->min;
1498 Stmt body = substitute(op->name, adjusted, op->body);
1499 stmt = For::make(op->name, 0, op->extent, op->for_type, op->device_api, body);
1500 }
1501 return stmt;
1502 }
1503
1504public:
1505 ZeroGPULoopMins() = default;
1506};
1507
1508class ValidateGPULoopNesting : public IRVisitor {
1509 int gpu_block_depth = 0, gpu_thread_depth = 0;
1510 string innermost_block_var, innermost_thread_var;
1511
1512 using IRVisitor::visit;
1513
1514 void visit(const For *op) override {
1515 ScopedValue<string> old_innermost_block_var(innermost_block_var);
1516 ScopedValue<string> old_innermost_thread_var(innermost_thread_var);
1517 ScopedValue<int> old_gpu_block_depth(gpu_block_depth);
1518 ScopedValue<int> old_gpu_thread_depth(gpu_thread_depth);
1519
1520 for (int i = 1; i <= 4; i++) {
1521 if (ends_with(op->name, block_names[4 - i])) {
1522 user_assert(i > gpu_block_depth)
1523 << "Invalid schedule: Loop over " << op->name
1524 << " cannot be inside of loop over " << innermost_block_var << "\n";
1525 user_assert(gpu_thread_depth == 0)
1526 << "Invalid schedule: Loop over " << op->name
1527 << " cannot be inside of loop over " << innermost_thread_var << "\n";
1528 innermost_block_var = op->name;
1529 gpu_block_depth = i;
1530 }
1531 if (ends_with(op->name, thread_names[4 - i])) {
1532 user_assert(i > gpu_thread_depth)
1533 << "Invalid schedule: Loop over " << op->name
1534 << " cannot be inside of loop over " << innermost_thread_var << "\n";
1535 user_assert(gpu_block_depth > 0)
1536 << "Invalid schedule: Loop over " << op->name
1537 << " must be inside a loop over gpu blocks\n";
1538 innermost_thread_var = op->name;
1539 gpu_thread_depth = i;
1540 }
1541 }
1542 IRVisitor::visit(op);
1543 }
1544};
1545
1546} // namespace
1547
1548// Also used by InjectImageIntrinsics
1549Stmt zero_gpu_loop_mins(const Stmt &s) {
1550 return ZeroGPULoopMins().mutate(s);
1551}

1555// Find the inner most GPU block of a statement.
1556class FindInnermostGPUBlock : public IRVisitor {
1557 using IRVisitor::visit;
1558
1559 void visit(const For *op) override {
1560 if (CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_block_var(op->name)) {
1561 // Set the last found GPU block to found_gpu_block.
1562 found_gpu_block = op;
1563 }
1564 IRVisitor::visit(op);
1565 }
1566
1567public:
1568 const For *found_gpu_block = nullptr;
1569};
1570
1571// Given a condition and a loop, add the condition
1572// to the loop body.
1573class AddConditionToALoop : public IRMutator {
1574 using IRMutator::visit;
1575
1576 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
1577 if (op != loop) {
1578 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1579 }
1580
1581 return For::make(op->name, op->min, op->extent, op->for_type, op->device_api,
1582 IfThenElse::make(condition, op->body, Stmt()));
1583 }
1584
1585public:
1586 AddConditionToALoop(const Expr &condition, const For *loop)
1587 : condition(condition), loop(loop) {
1588 }
1589 const Expr &condition;
1590 const For *loop;
1591};
1592
1593// Push if statements between GPU blocks through all GPU blocks.
1594// Throw error if the if statement has an else clause.
1595class NormalizeIfStatements : public IRMutator {
1596 using IRMutator::visit;
1597
1598 bool inside_gpu_blocks = false;
1599
1600 Stmt visit(const For *op) override {
1601 if (!CodeGen_GPU_Dev::is_gpu_block_var(op->name)) {
1602 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1603 }
1604 ScopedValue<bool> old_inside_gpu_blocks(inside_gpu_blocks, true);
1605 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1606 }
1607
1608 Stmt visit(const IfThenElse *op) override {
1609 if (!inside_gpu_blocks) {
1610 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1611 }
1612 FindInnermostGPUBlock find;
1613 op->accept(&find);
1614 if (find.found_gpu_block != nullptr) {
1615 internal_assert(!op->else_case.defined()) << "Found an if statement with else case between two GPU blocks.\n";
1616 return AddConditionToALoop(op->condition, find.found_gpu_block).mutate(op->then_case);
1617 }
1618 return IRMutator::visit(op);
1619 }
1620};
1621
1622} // namespace
1623
1624Stmt fuse_gpu_thread_loops(Stmt s) {
1625 ValidateGPULoopNesting validate;
1626 s.accept(&validate);
1627 // NormalizeIfStatements pushes the predicates between GPU blocks
1628 // into the innermost GPU block. FuseGPUThreadLoops would then
1629 // merge the predicate into the merged GPU thread.
1630 s = NormalizeIfStatements().mutate(s);
1631 s = FuseGPUThreadLoops().mutate(s);
1632 s = ZeroGPULoopMins().mutate(s);
1633 return s;
1634}
